item.title: Using SLY to connect to a slynk server in vagrant
item.description: I want to be able to use sly, but I particularly want to be able to use it in my vagrant machines. sly-tramp seems to help with that. In order to use slynk remotely, first, I need to initialize the correct version of the slynk server remotely. The vagrant machines have the sly repository cloned to ~/sly and the following added to .sbclrc: (push #p"~/sly/slynk/" ASDF:*CENTRAL-REGISTRY*) (asdf:require-system :slynk) (slynk:create-server :port 4005) ; adjust this accordingly I then activate the sly-tramp contrib add the following to 'sly-filename-translations:

item.title: Publications
item.description: References [1] James Allen, Hannah An, Ritwik Bose, Will de Beaumont, and Choh Man Teng. 2020. A broad-coverage deep semantic lexicon for verbs. In Proceedings of the 12th language resources and evaluation conference, European Language Resources Association, Marseille, France, 3243–3251. Retrieved from https://www.aclweb.org/anthology/2020.lrec-1.396 [2] Michael A. Bender, Ritwik Bose, Rezaul Chowdhury, and Samuel McCauley. 2012. The kissing problem: How to end a gathering when everyone kisses everyone else goodbye. In Fun with algorithms, Springer Berlin Heidelberg, Berlin, Heidelberg, 28–39.
